author: mariohavel
content:
Hey! Please make sure to check the mentorship guide first https://github.com/eth-protocol-fellows/cohort-four/blob/master/program-guide/mentors.md
Generally we recommend doing your own research about the topic before reaching out to mentors and also, as the program did not officially started (we are still in week 0, preparation/learning phase), mentors might not be available yet. Please feel free to post your question here and tag corresponding mentor or reach out to me for some initial feedback and based on that I can connect you to the right mentor.

author: lightclient
content: if anyone has js experience, this would be a nice place to get started and would be a really big improvement https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/issues/431

author: kaydenml
content: https://github.com/ethereum/glados/pull/136 Iâ€™m plan on working hard on glados, creating interesting ways to visualize important data through different graphs on the page and trying to make everything look nice and cleaner as well as the main page of glados . In this pull request I created a pie chart to display how many nodes are on the network and which clients they are so trin, fluffy, ultralight and unknown. Before it had a linear runtime complexity with respect to the number of rows that are in the database which means it would take longer and longer the larger our database grows. But I have fixed this issue with the code to solve the linear run time complexity by first creating pier sql that solves this issue then converting it to sea-orm there are still more changes I need to complete before this can be merged . Just thought I would give a update and now I thinking of other interesting data that would be interesting to display through different graphs.

author: soulgenesis3800
content:
Hey <@543900561460822016> , I made this API spec while working at my previous company.
https://docs.chainstack.com/reference/ethereum-getblocknumber
README has a really nice framework for building API documentation.

author: lightclient
content: this looks really nice!

author: lightclient
content: one thing i don't think they haven though is the ability to generate from an open-rpc specification - which we need, since the source of truth is the spec itself

author: lightclient
content: the reason i mention docusaurus is because there is a plugin written by the open rpc creators: https://github.com/MetaMask/docusaurus-openrpc/

author: soulgenesis3800
content:
No no. Look at these.

I made the whole Polygon zkEVM spec using their OPEN-rpc specification.

Polygon's zkevm spec: https://github.com/0xPolygonHermez/zkevm-node/blob/develop/jsonrpc/endpoints_zkevm.openrpc.json

What I made: https://docs.chainstack.com/reference/zkevm-consolidatedblocknumber

author: soulgenesis3800
content:
but yes, docusaurus might be a better choice. I don't know, haven't worked with it.
But README works with open-rpc too.

author: lightclient
content: oh okay i see, how does it generate the docs from that?

author: lightclient
content: this is really awesome

author: soulgenesis3800
content: It generates these pics from the open-rpc spce, but I manually wrote the Ethers, and web3 js examples. That was my work.

author: joshd4078
content:
Hey all, we did send out some application status emails today. If you were not selected to receive a stipend, I recommend staying active in this channel and participating as much as you can in a permissionless way. We set aside part of our budget to reward permissionless participants, and making valuable, permissionless contributions is a great way to gain visibility and experience for the next cohort or even get seen by client teams.

We will be posting her frequently with next steps, meeting times, and other important information. If you are interested in continuing in the program, make sure to check in to this channel often.

author: joshd4078
content: This is the main channel for any communications regarding general operations and coordination.
